term.title: symbiosis

item.text: The term was originally applied to describe the maximum flocking of either hard or soft ligands in the same complexes. For hydrocarbon molecules, symbiosis implies that those containing a maximum number of C–H bonds (e.g. CH4) or C–C bonds (e.g. Me4C) are the most stable.

sources.item: PAC, 1994, 66, 1077. 'Glossary of terms used in physical organic chemistry (IUPAC Recommendations 1994)' on page 1170 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199466051077)

term.citation: Citation: 'symbiosis' in IUPAC Compendium of Chemical Terminology, 5th ed. International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry; 2025. Online version 5.0.0, 2025. 10.1351/goldbook.S06209

Users of these terms are encouraged to include the version of a term with its use and to check regularly for updates to term definitions that you are using.
